intro: Manglietia chingii, commonly known as the Chinese manglietia, is a rare and ancient flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Yunnan, China. It belongs to the family Magnoliaceae, which includes some of the most primitive angiosperms. The plant is characterized by its large, showy white flowers and broad, lance-shaped leaves. It is a woody shrub or small tree that typically grows in shaded, moist forest environments.
